result.execSummary:
The defendant Kai R Stauersbol was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kai R Stauersbol is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kai R Stauersbol was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Cash bond posted shall be applied.  
*  Pay DNA surcharge.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency  to pay child support and make all court appearances.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular on 9-18-17

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Ben Schwarz.  Deft reports he was held in custody for 4 or 5 days due to the new charges.  Court admonishes deft about driving without a license.  No further court action at this time.
Benjamin Schwarz  kmk

Minutes:  14CM1844/15CM302.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft has new charges pending; Atty Ben Schwarz represents deft.  RH set over to 3/7/16 @ 2:30pm.  Deft instructed to report to the PD's office regarding representation on these two files.

received from deft requesting to adjourn 2/17/16 hrg (out of town on business).  Clerk returned deft's call - informed him that he was aware of this court since 2/5/16 (his agent gave him the info).  Deft informed the message would be passed onto the Court, but it would be up to court whether to adjourn the hrg
Review hearing at 02-17-2016 10:30 am

Minutes:  14CM1844 & 15CM302.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Cases are resolved.  

14CM1844 - deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

15CM302 - deft pleads guilty to count 3; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion. 

Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  Bond to apply to financial obligations.  Balance may be returned to poster.
